title: ISic001060. I.Sicily inscription 001060
body:
1ἐπὶ γυμνασιάρχ ω̣ [ν]
2Ἀριστίω̣ν̣ος – [το]ῦ Ἀγαθ̣ [---]
3Φιλιστίωνος – τοῦ Ἐπικράτ̣[εος]
4νεανίσ̣κ̣[οι Ἱερ]ώνειο[ι]

1ΕΠΙΓΥΜΝΑΣΙΑΡΧ.[.]
2ΑΡΙΣΤΙ..ΟΣ–[..]ΥΑΓΑ.[---]
3ΦΙΛΙΣΤΙΩΝΟΣ–ΤΟΥΕΠΙΚΡΑ.[...]
4ΝΕΑΝΙ..[.....]ΩΝΕΙΟ[.]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text checked against photograph (and rapid visual inspection);
  • 2: Manganaro: Ἀγαθ[άρχου]

English translation

Giorgia Capra

When Aristion son of Agath[---] and Philistion son of Epikrates were gymnasiarchs, the neaniskoi Hieroneioi (dedicated this).

Italian translation

Giorgia Capra

Quando Aristione figlio di Agath[---] e Filistione figlio di Epicrate erano ginnasiarchi, i neaniskoi Hieroneioi (dedicarono questo)

commentary

The text was first reported by Fazello in the 16th century, but removed from the site in 1894.

  • 55.1015 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796

  • Fazello 1558 Prioris Decadis, Liber Quartus, p.109 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002606
  • Orsi NSA 1897 81-82 fig.12 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001392
  • Manganaro 1963 55 and n.32 ph https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001850
  • Manganaro 1992 452-455 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001830
  • Bringmann and von Steuben 1995 no.306 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002124
  • Manganaro 2001 78 no. I, fig. 4 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001806
  • Ferruti 2004 191-193 fig.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001994
  • Inglese 2014 94-95 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001362
